contrastmodel.functions package¶

Submodules¶

contrastmodel.functions.filtergen module¶

This module contains functions used for generation of ODOG and Gabor filters

contrastmodel.functions.filtergen.gen_odog(rows, cols, row_std, col_std, sr1, sr2, theta, center_weight)¶

Generates a 2D Oriented Difference of Gaussian (ODOG) filter

Parameters:
  • rows (int) – number of rows in the filter
  • cols (int) – number of columns in the filter
  • row_std (float) – standard deviation in the vertical direction before rotation
  • col_std (float) – standard deviation in the horizontal direction before rotation
  • sr1 (float) – scaling factor for row_std
  • sr2 (float) – scaling factor for col_std
  • theta (float) – angle to which the filter is rotated counterclockwise
  • center_weight (float) – scaling factor for the peak of the Gaussian
Returns:

2D Difference-Of-Gaussian filter
Return type:

numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray
contrastmodel.functions.filtergen.trimfilt(filt, threshold)¶

flattens values between +threshold and -threshold to 0, then deletes all-zero rows from all sides of 2D array

Parameters:
  • filt (numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray) – filter to be flattened
  • threshold (float) – values between positive and negative threshold become 0
Returns:

flattened filter
Return type:

numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray

contrastmodel.functions.imaging module¶

This module contains functions for generating image files

contrastmodel.functions.imaging.generate_image(img, title, filename, img_dir, cmap='jet', maximize=False)¶

generates figure image from array and saves it to file

Parameters:
  • img (numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray) – array of values to be displayed
  • title (str) – title for the figure
  • filename (str) – name of the file that the image will be saved to
  • img_dir (str) – directory the file will be saved in
  • cmap (str) – colormap used in rendering the figure
  • maximize (bool) – whether or not to maximize the figure before saving

contrastmodel.functions.masks module¶

This module contains functions related to generating correlation masks for filters

contrastmodel.functions.masks.generate_correlation_mask(params)¶

Generates array of correlation values between two filters (as described in Troyer et al.) ELEMENTWISE VERSION - USES HUGE AMOUNTS OF MEMORY (>20GB)

Parameters:params (contrastmodel.params.paramsDef.FilterParams) – model and filter parameters
Returns:dictionary of correlation masks, keys in format [o][f][o2][f2], where o and f are orientation and frequency of postsynaptic filter, and o2 and f2 are orientation and frequency of presynaptic filter
Return type:dict[int, dict[int, dict[int, dict[int, numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray]]]]
contrastmodel.functions.masks.generate_correlation_mask_fft(params)¶

Generates array of correlation values between two filters (as described in Troyer et al.) FFT VERSION - USES THIS ONE

Parameters:params (contrastmodel.params.paramsDef.FilterParams) – model and filter parameters
Returns:dictionary of correlation masks, keys in format [o][f][o2][f2], where o and f are orientation and frequency of postsynaptic filter, and o2 and f2 are orientation and frequency of presynaptic filter
Return type:dict[int, dict[int, dict[int, dict[int, numpy.core.multiarray.ndarray]]]]

contrastmodel.functions.stimuli module¶

contains class definition for stimuli

class contrastmodel.functions.stimuli.Stim(stimtype, params, variant='')¶

Stimulus processed by model - also holds filter responses to each stimulus
